option.name: fileSummaryMaps
option.value: {"C:/Users/medal/IdeaProjects/SmartEnergySystemWebApp":"{\"/src/main/java/rmi/AppareilImpl.java\":\"This file contains a single class and several functions. Here\\u0027s a summary of each:\\n\\n`AppareilImpl`: This class extends `UnicastRemoteObject` and implements the `AppareilInterface`, providing a remote implementation of an \\\"Appareil\\\" (device) service.\\n\\n`eteindre()`: This method prints a message indicating that the device has been turned off.\\n\\n`main()`: This function sets up an RMI registry, creates an instance of the `AppareilImpl` class, and binds it to the registry under the name \\\"AppareilService\\\". It also handles any exceptions that may occur during the setup process.\\n\\nOverall, this file sets up a remote server that provides a simple \\\"Appareil\\\" service, allowing clients to interact with it using RMI.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/Main.java\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it is a simple Java program that prints \\\"Hello and welcome!\\\" and then prints the values of the variable `i` from 1 to 5.\\n\\nThe file provides several tips and shortcuts for running, debugging, and using IntelliJ IDEA, a popular Integrated Development Environment (IDE) for Java development.\",\"/ml/predict_ml.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`predict_energy`: Predicts energy consumption using a trained ML model or a simulated prediction if the model is not available.\\n\\n`simulate_prediction`: Simulates energy prediction when the ML model is not available, using realistic patterns based on the time of day and day of the week.\\n\\n`main`: The main function that can be called from Java or the command line to make energy consumption predictions.\\n\\nThe file is a Python script that provides a way to predict energy consumption using a trained machine learning model or a simulated prediction if the model is not available. It can be used as a standalone script or integrated into a larger system.\",\"/src/main/java/corba/TempsClient.java\":\"This file is a CORBA client that retrieves dynamic information (hour, day, and week) from a CORBA server and can potentially send this data to a machine learning module for further processing.\\n\\n`TempsClient`: The main class that initializes the CORBA ORB, retrieves the CORBA object from the naming service, and calls the methods to get the dynamic information.\\n\\n`main`: The main function that runs the CORBA client and retrieves the dynamic information from the CORBA server.\",\"/src/main/java/corba/TempsImpl.java\":\"This file contains a single class `TempsImpl` and several functions within it. Here\\u0027s a summary of each:\\n\\n`TempsImpl`: This class implements the `SmartHome.Temps` interface, providing methods to retrieve the current hour, day of the week, and whether it\\u0027s a weekend.\\n\\n`getHeure()`: This method returns the current hour.\\n`getJour()`: This method returns the current day of the week (1 for Monday, 7 for Sunday).\\n`getWeekend()`: This method returns 1 if it\\u0027s a weekend, 0 otherwise.\\n`appelerML(int, int, int)`: This method calls a Python script `predict_ml.py` with the provided hour, day, and weekend values, and returns the output.\\n`main(String[])`: This is the main entry point of the program, which initializes the CORBA ORB, creates an instance of the `TempsImpl` class, and binds it to the CORBA naming service.\",\"/src/main/java/controller/ControllerMain.java\":\"This file appears to be a Java program that serves as the main controller for a smart home system. It uses CORBA to interact with a \\\"TempsService\\\" to retrieve information about the current hour, day, and whether it\\u0027s a weekend. Based on this information, it determines if the energy consumption is high and takes appropriate actions, such as turning off appliances via RMI and sending a notification via JMS.\\n\\n`ControllerMain`: The main class that initializes the CORBA ORB, retrieves the \\\"TempsService\\\" object, and performs the necessary actions based on the energy consumption level.\\n\\n`getHeure()`: Retrieves the current hour from the \\\"TempsService\\\".\\n\\n`getJour()`: Retrieves the current day from the \\\"TempsService\\\".\\n\\n`getWeekend()`: Retrieves the information about whether it\\u0027s a weekend from the \\\"TempsService\\\".\\n\\n`analyserConsommation()`: (Not implemented in the provided code) Analyzes the energy consumption based on the retrieved information.\\n\\n`eteindre()`: (Accessed via RMI) Turns off the appliances when the energy consumption is high.\\n\\n`envoyer()`: (Accessed via JMS) Sends a notification when the energy consumption is high.\",\"/src/main/java/corba/SmartHome/TempsHolder.java\":\"This file appears to be a Java class generated by an IDL-to-Java compiler, which is part of the CORBA (Common Object Request Broker Architecture) framework. The file defines a class called `TempsHolder` that implements the `org.omg.CORBA.portable.Streamable` interface.\\n\\n`TempsHolder`: A class that holds a `Temps` object and provides methods to read, write, and get the type code of the `Temps` object.\\n\\n`TempsHolder()`: The default constructor for the `TempsHolder` class.\\n\\n`TempsHolder(Temps)`: A constructor for the `TempsHolder` class that takes a `Temps` object as a parameter and initializes the `value` field.\\n\\n`_read(org.omg.CORBA.portable.InputStream)`: A method that reads a `Temps` object from the given input stream and assigns it to the `value` field.\\n\\n`_write(org.omg.CORBA.portable.OutputStream)`: A method that writes the `Temps` object stored in the `value` field to the given output stream.\\n\\n`_type()`: A method that returns the type code of the `Temps` object.\",\"/src/main/java/jms/NotificationJMS.java\":\"This file contains a single class and one function:\\n\\n`NotificationJMS`: This class is responsible for sending a message to an ActiveMQ message queue.\\n\\n`envoyer(String msg)`: This function sends the provided message to the \\\"ALERTE_CONSO\\\" queue using an ActiveMQConnectionFactory, a Connection, a Session, and a MessageProducer.\",\"/src/main/java/corba/SmartHome/TempsOperations.java\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`getHeure()`: Returns the current hour.\\n\\n`getJour()`: Returns the current day.\\n\\n`getWeekend()`: Returns whether the current day is a weekend or not.\\n\\nThis file appears to be an interface definition for a CORBA (Common Object Request Broker Architecture) service called \\\"Temps\\\" that provides information about the current time and day.\",\"/src/main/java/corba/SmartHome/Temps.java\":\"This file appears to be an interface definition for a CORBA (Common Object Request Broker Architecture) component called `Temps`. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines an interface that can be implemented by other components.\\n\\nThe `Temps` interface extends the `TempsOperations` interface and inherits from the `org.omg.CORBA.Object` and `org.omg.CORBA.portable.IDLEntity` interfaces. This suggests that the `Temps` interface is a part of a larger CORBA-based system, and it likely provides some functionality related to temperature or environmental monitoring in a \\\"smart home\\\" context.\",\"/src/main/java/corba/SmartHome/TempsPOA.java\":\"This file appears to be an implementation of the `Temps` interface in the `SmartHome` CORBA module. It contains the following:\\n\\n`TempsPOA`: An abstract class that implements the `TempsOperations` interface and provides the implementation for the `getHeure()`, `getJour()`, and `getWeekend()` methods.\\n\\n`_invoke`: A method that handles the invocation of the `getHeure()`, `getJour()`, and `getWeekend()` methods and returns the appropriate response.\\n\\n`_all_interfaces`: A method that returns the list of all interfaces implemented by the `TempsPOA` class.\\n\\n`_this()`: Methods that return a reference to the `Temps` object.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any other classes or functions, and its primary purpose is to provide the server-side implementation of the `Temps` interface in a CORBA-based smart home system.\",\"/src/main/java/web/Webserver.java\":\"This file is the main entry point for the \\\"Smart Energy System\\\" application. It starts all the required services, including CORBA, RMI, and a web server, and provides a web-based dashboard for monitoring and controlling the system.\\n\\n`WebServer`: The main class that manages the entire system, including starting and stopping the various services.\\n\\n`startORBD()`: Starts the CORBA Name Service.\\n`startCORBAServer()`: Starts the CORBA server.\\n`startRMIServer()`: Starts the RMI server.\\n`initCORBA(String[] args)`: Initializes the CORBA client connection.\\n`startHTTPServer()`: Starts the HTTP server and sets up the various API endpoints.\\n`startBackgroundCollector()`: Starts a background thread to collect energy data and send notifications.\\n`collectEnergyData()`: Collects energy data from the CORBA service, makes predictions using an ML model, and updates the energy history and notifications.\\n`callMLPrediction(int heure, int jour, int weekend)`: Calls the ML prediction script to get the predicted energy consumption.\\n`parsePrediction(String output)`: Parses the output of the ML prediction script to extract the predicted energy consumption.\\n`isPortInUse(int port)`: Checks if a given port is already in use.\\n`openBrowser(String url)`: Opens the default web browser with the given URL.\\n`cleanup()`: Performs cleanup tasks when the system is shutting down.\\n`DashboardHandler`: Handles requests for the web-based dashboard.\\n`StatusHandler`: Handles requests for the system status.\\n`RealtimeHandler`: Handles requests for real-time energy data.\\n`HistoryHandler`: Handles requests for the energy history.\\n`PredictHandler`: Handles requests for energy consumption predictions.\\n`DeviceHandler`: Handles requests for controlling devices via RMI.\\n`NotificationsHandler`: Handles requests for the notification history.\\n`ThresholdHandler`: Handles requests for updating the energy consumption threshold.\",\"/web/dashboard.html\":\"This file is an HTML document that creates a dashboard for a smart energy system. It uses JavaScript, Chart.js, and Tailwind CSS to display real-time data, historical energy consumption, device control, notifications, system status, logs, and configuration options. The file does not contain any classes, but it has several functions that handle the various features of the dashboard.\\n\\n`setupEventListeners`: Sets up event listeners for the various buttons and controls in the dashboard.\\n\\n`initializeChart`: Initializes the energy consumption chart using Chart.js.\\n\\n`fetchData`: Fetches real-time data, historical data, and notifications from the API and updates the corresponding elements in the dashboard.\\n\\n`updateRealtimeData`: Updates the real-time data display in the dashboard.\\n\\n`updateChart`: Updates the energy consumption chart with the fetched historical data.\\n\\n`updateDevices`: Updates the simulated device status and control in the dashboard.\\n\\n`updateNotifications`: Updates the notifications display in the dashboard.\\n\\n`fetchSystemStatus`: Fetches the system status and updates the corresponding elements in the dashboard.\\n\\n`updateLogs`: Updates the CORBA and ML service logs in the dashboard.\\n\\n`showSimulatedData`: Displays simulated data in the dashboard if the API is not available.\\n\\n`toggleDevice`: Toggles the state of a device (simulated).\\n\\n`shutdownAllDevices`: Shuts down all devices (simulated).\\n\\n`saveConfiguration`: Saves the configuration settings (consumption threshold and auto-shutdown) to the API.\\n\\n`exportData`: Exports the current real-time data to a JSON file.\\n\\n`markRead`: Marks a notification as read (simulated).\\n\\n`startAutoUpdate`: Starts the automatic data update interval.\",\"/src/main/java/corba/SmartHome/TempsHelper.java\":\"This file appears to be a Java class that provides helper methods for working with the `Temps` interface in the `SmartHome` CORBA module. It does not contain any classes, but rather a set of static methods for interacting with the `Temps` interface.\\n\\n`insert`: Inserts a `Temps` object into a CORBA `Any` object.\\n`extract`: Extracts a `Temps` object from a CORBA `Any` object.\\n`type`: Returns the CORBA `TypeCode` for the `Temps` interface.\\n`id`: Returns the ID string for the `Temps` interface.\\n`read`: Reads a `Temps` object from a CORBA input stream.\\n`write`: Writes a `Temps` object to a CORBA output stream.\\n`narrow`: Narrows a CORBA object to a `Temps` object.\\n`unchecked_narrow`: Performs an unchecked narrow of a CORBA object to a `Temps` object.\",\"/src/main/java/rmi/AppareilInterface.java\":\"This file defines an interface named `AppareilInterface` that extends the `Remote` interface from the Java RMI (Remote Method Invocation) library.\\n\\n`AppareilInterface`: An interface that defines a remote method for turning off an appliance.\\n\\n`eteindre()`: A method that throws a `RemoteException` and is intended to be implemented by a remote object to turn off an appliance.\",\"/src/main/java/corba/SmartHome/_TempsStub.java\":\"This file appears to be an implementation of the `Temps` interface in the `SmartHome` package. It contains the following classes and functions:\\n\\n`_TempsStub`: This class is a stub implementation of the `Temps` interface, which provides methods to retrieve the current hour, day, and whether it is a weekend.\\n\\n`getHeure()`: This function returns the current hour.\\n`getJour()`: This function returns the current day.\\n`getWeekend()`: This function returns whether it is a weekend or not.\\n`_ids()`: This function returns the list of interface IDs implemented by this class.\\n`readObject()`: This function is used to deserialize the object from a stream.\\n`writeObject()`: This function is used to serialize the object to a stream.\"}"}
